p: The meat sample (5 g) was mixed with 0.1% peptone water (45 g) in a Stomacher and homogenized (200 rpm, 1.0 min). The subsequent dilutions (10 –1 to 10 –6) were then prepared in the test tubes containing 0.1% peptone water. The dilutions were inoculated into the plates containing culture medium and to perform the following microbial tests: total viable count (TVC) bacterial count in PCA (48 hr incubation at 37°C), psychrotrophic count (PTC) in PCA (10 days of incubation at 7°C), S. aureus count in MSA (24‐hr incubation at 37°C), E. coli count in EMB (24‐hr incubation at 37°C), and Fungi count in SDA (72‐hr incubation at 27°C) (Alizadeh Behbahani & Imani Fooladi, 2018b).
